thread.title: Whole Foods To Sell Coffee for (Gasp) 25 Cents a Cup
thread.title_full: Whole Foods To Sell Coffee for (Gasp) 25 Cents a Cup

title: Whole Foods To Sell Coffee for (Gasp) 25 Cents a Cup
text:
Get Business & Technology Alerts 
18 Sep 2015 02:01 AM EST 
A good old cup o' Joe may finally give the drink a run for its money. Whole Foods recently launched a new program that will offer customers a cup of coffee for 25 cents—no strings attached. The perk is one of many featured at Whole Foods this fall, tailored around a new marketing venture by the chain called "Love Fest." It's a program geared toward showing customers—well—love. The company's executive vice president of operations, David Lannon, said in a statement, "We are looking forward to deepening our connections with customers and saying 'thank you' and 'we love you.'"
